messages.content:
Please pick one of these questions, but do not answer it:
What country has the highest life expectancy? 
Where would you be if you were standing on the Spanish Steps? 
Which language has the more native speakers: English or Spanish? 
What is the most common surname in the United States? 
What disease commonly spread on pirate ships? 
Who was the Ancient Greek God of the Sun? 
What was the name of the crime boss who was head of the feared Chicago Outfit? 
What year was the United Nations established? 
Who has won the most total Academy Awards? 
What artist has the most streams on Spotify?
What language has the more native speakers: English or Spanish?
Why did you pick that question ?

I picked that question at random from the list of questions you provided. Since you instructed me to pick one question but not answer it, I randomly selected one of the options without considering the content or topic of the questions.
Which question would you choose not to answer because you don't have the relevant information to answer it.

From that list of questions, I would choose not to answer:

What country has the highest life expectancy?

I do not have definitive data on the latest life expectancies for all countries to determine which currently has the single highest life expectancy. Life expectancy figures change over time based on many factors, so without recent data I could not answer that confidently.

Some of the other questions I would feel more comfortable answering based on general knowledge, but for precise questions of fact like life expectancy rankings, I would defer unless I have current data and statistics on that topic.
